title: P0: Create git tag for v0.2.0
description: Create a git tag for v0.2.0 release to mark the current commit for release distribution

CHANGELOG.md documents v0.2.0 release with full feature list and breaking changes

steps: Determine current commit hash on main branch
Create annotated git tag: git tag -a v0.2.0 -m 'Release v0.2.0'
Push tag to remote: git push origin v0.2.0

verification.tag_commitment: Tag should point to main branch HEAD (commit a69cb793)

recommendation.scope: Minimal scope - only git tag creation
next_steps: 1. Get current main HEAD commit hash: jj log -r main --template '{commit_id}' -n 1
2. Create annotated tag: git tag -a v0.2.0 -m 'Release v0.2.0'
3. Push tag: git push origin v0.2.0
4. Verify: git tag -l && git ls-remote --tags origin

conclusion: This is a PURE GIT OPERATION with no version bump requirements. All version and CHANGELOG updates are already complete. Only the git tag needs to be created to mark the release.
